summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 9, 2019, providing an operational update on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It details the status of locating and serving grand jury subpoenas to 10 co-conspirators, plans to interview approximately 25 victims in Florida, and the scheduling of Epstein's bail hearing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his bail argument is due and a bail hearing is scheduled.

events.title: Epstein's Bail Argument Due
events.description: Epstein's bail argument is due to the judge.

events.title: Epstein's Bail Hearing
events.description: The actual bail hearing for Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled.

events.title: Operational Update and Victim Interviews
events.description: The investigative team (8 SAs/ITFOs, 2 AUSAs) is flying to various locations in Florida to interview approximately 25 victims. Status is provided on serving 10 co-conspirators.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively pursuing 10 co-conspirators in the Epstein case, with 6 successfully served grand jury subpoenas and 4 outstanding as of July 9, 2019.
An investigative team of 8 Special Agents/ITFOs and 2 Assistant U.S. Attorneys was deploying to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims.
A dedicated 1-800-CALL-FBI tip line had received about 45 calls related to the case, which were being vetted.
Jeffrey Epstein's bail argument was due to a judge by Thursday, July 11, 2019, with the bail hearing set for Monday, July 15, 2019.
One of the outstanding co-conspirators was identified as a wealthy businessman in Ohio, prompting a lead to be sent to the appropriate field office (CV).
